com.samsung.samm.common

Class SObjectVideo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.samm.common.SObject
      • com.samsung.samm.common.SObjectVideo

  • public class SObjectVideo
extends SObject
    Class for exchanging video object data.
    Since:
    S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

    • Field Detail

      • SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL

        public static final byte SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL
        The standard video style.
        If you select this style, you must set the video file path and thumbnail image.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_URL

        public static final byte SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_URL
        The URL type for the video style.
        If you select this style, you must set the video URL and thumbnail image.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_CUSTOM

        public static final byte SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_CUSTOM
        The custom video style.
        The video style to be used by the application for a special purpose.
        Available if you use a custom application video resource. The style of a custom application video resource is referenced through the getAdditionalValue() method.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SObjectVideo

        public SObjectVideo()
        Constructs a video object.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • SObjectVideo

        public SObjectVideo(int nContentsQualityOption)
        Constructs a video object.
        Parameters:
        nContentsQualityOption - Contents quality option (SOptionSAMM.SAMM_CONTENTS_QUALITY_MAX, SOptionSAMM.SAMM_CONTENTS_QUALITY_MEDIUM, SOptionSAMM.SAMM_CONTENTS_QUALITY_MINIMUM, SOptionSAMM.SAMM_CONTENTS_QUALITY_ORIGINAL)
        When using the default constructor instead, the content quality option is set to SOptionSAMM.SAMM_CONTENTS_QUALITY_MEDIUM.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

    • Method Detail

      • setStyle

        public boolean setStyle(int nStyle)
        Sets the style of the video object.
        Parameters:
        nStyle - Video style. One of SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL, or SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_CUSTOM.
        Returns:
        False if the specified style is not predefined
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • setThumbnailImageBitmap

        public boolean setThumbnailImageBitmap(Bitmap bm)
        Sets the thumbnail bitmap image of the video object.
        The video style must be set to SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL or SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_URL.
        Parameters:
        bm - image
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • getThumbnailImageBitmap

        public Bitmap getThumbnailImageBitmap()
        Gets the bitmap image data of the public Bitmap getImageBitmap() video object.
        If a bitmap has been set via setImageBitmap(Bitmap bm), the bitmap is returned directly.
        If an image file path is set via setImagePath(String path), a bitmap is loaded and returned from the designated image file. The bitmap is, however, resized according to the set contents quality option before being returned.
        Returns:
        Image bitmap
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • getThumbnailImageBitmap

        public Bitmap getThumbnailImageBitmap(int nMaxWidth,
                             int nMaxHeight)
        Gets the thumbnail bitmap image data of the video object.
        The returned bitmap is set via setImageBitmap(Bitmap bm) or setImagePath(String path) and resized according to the content quality option.
        If the content quality option set in the constructor is SOptionSAMM.SAMM_CONTENTS_QUALITY_ORIGINAL or undefined, the original image bitmap is returned.
        For other instances, nMaxWidth and nMaxHeight are used to resize the returning bitmap.
        Parameters:
        nMaxWidth - The maximum width of the returned bitmap. nCanvasWidth<=0 equals getImageBitmap()
        nMaxHeight - The maximum height of the returned bitmap. nCanvasHeight<=0 equals getImageBitmap()
        Returns:
        Image bitmap
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • setThumbnailImagePath

        public boolean setThumbnailImagePath(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the thumbnail bitmap image with a file path.
        The video style must be set to SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL or SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_URL.
        Parameters:
        path - Image file path
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • getThumbnailImagePath

        public java.lang.String getThumbnailImagePath()
        Gets the original thumbnail image file path of the video object.
        Internal attachments cannot be opened in an external application through file associations. To open an internal attachment, you must copy it to an external path.
        Returns:
        The file path of the original thumbnail image file
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • setVideoPath

        public boolean setVideoPath(java.lang.String videoFilePath)
        Sets the video file path.
        The video style must be set to SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL.
        Parameters:
        path - Video file path
        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • getVideoPath

        public java.lang.String getVideoPath()
        Gets the original video file path of the video object.
        The video style must be set to SAMM_VIDEOSTYLE_NORMAL.
        Internal attachments cannot be opened in an external application through file associations. To open an internal attachment, you must copy it to an external path.
        Returns:
        The file path of the original video file
        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

      • isValidVideoData

        Gets whether or not the video and the thumbnail image are valid.
        Returns:

        Since:
        S-Pen SDK 2.3, SAMM Library 1.7

        Returns:
        True for success. False for failure.
